item.title: Convert all JPG images to AVIF
item.description: It loops through all the jpg images in the folder and converts them to AVIF with the given configuration of quality and size. It requires libavif to be installed on the machine. If you’re on MacOS grab it on Homebrew. `for file in *.jpg; do avifenc -q 50 --speed 3 --ignore-exif "$file" -o "${file%.*}.avif"; done`

item.title: Convert all JPG images to webP
item.description: It loops through all the jpg images in the folder and converts them to webP with the given configuration of quality and size. It requires cwebp to be installed on the machine. for file in *.jpg; do cwebp -q 85 -m 6 -resize 1800 0 -metadata none "$file" -o "${file%.*}.webp"; done
